topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: The Great Pier Heist of '78
ideas.premise: Nana recounts her 'fishing trip' to St Kilda Pier in the 70s, revealing it was actually a daring, seagull-assisted mission to steal a year's supply of calamari.
ideas.why_funny: Unexpected twist, classic Aussie larrikinism, plus the seagull accomplice.

ideas.title: Port Phillip Bay Kraken
ideas.premise: Nana swears she saw a Kraken in Port Phillip Bay but everyone assumes it was just the Spirit of Tasmania ferry.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of mythical monster and mundane Melbourne ferry.

ideas.title: The Talking Fish & Chips
ideas.premise: A talking flathead fillet (fresh from Queen Victoria Market, naturally) argues with Nana about the best sauce while she's walking along Southbank.
ideas.why_funny: Relatable Aussie experience with a surreal talking fish twist.

ideas.title: Nana's Mordialloc Mermaid
ideas.premise: Nana claims she rescued a mermaid tangled in a discarded Bunnings snag wrapper off Mordialloc pier, but the mermaid just wanted directions to Chapel Street.
ideas.why_funny: Absurd situation; mermaid prioritising shopping over ocean life.

ideas.title: Stingray Shuffle
ideas.premise: Nana teaches tourists how to do the 'Stingray Shuffle' at Brighton Beach, which is actually just her aggressively stomping the sand to scare them away.
ideas.why_funny: The Stingray Shuffle is very important safety information at Brighton Beach, but this is not that.

headlines.title: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories
headlines.summary: Actor and author Tasma Walton was enjoying her big break on TV show Blue Heelers in the 1990s in Melbourne when a transformative visit from her grandm
